pros: Everything is fine and I have good experience

pros: Good place to learn but hardware only

pros: Great Mission, Great people, Hardworking bunch.
cons: Systemic Problems within Every Department of This Organization. Constant Turnover- you're just a number to them. Slang used daily- very difficult for new people to catch on, constant travel- it will break down your car. Management is the ultimate problem and downfall of this organization, No opportunities for promotions or growth. Management is very stuck in the 90's- with no desire to become up-to-date. Flawed Execution on EVERY level, Lack of leadership from the very top down. Systems are out of date, and you will spend more time retracing your steps than actually helping kids.

review_title: Great Mission...Fails to Execute In-House Hypocrisy at it's finest
pros: Great pay. Work with mostly passionate employees
cons: Very poor management. Seemed more concerned with their own image to the Board. Toxic work environment, very negative, very stressful. Board has way too much say so in the daily office business, staff goals, staff worth. Lied to and about staff. Mistakes made with $ and hidden, staff asked to hide and lie...to Exec Board and area boards. Very, Very high turnover. No one able to work more than 5 years. Stress-induced illness among staff very very prevalent, and oddly, when they quit--so did their symptoms. Work-place bullying was tolerated. Victims of it were victimized by management and some board members. Secrets, gossip, theft. Terrible--worst job I had. But the mission and vision were great. Too bad what was taught in classrooms re:Soft Skills are not able to be practiced in the JA office.

pros: Great Mission. Fun working with the kids and other coordinators.
cons: The management are all "best buddies" with each other so they play favorites and its really obvious. The raises are a joke.. .10 or .15 an hour?  Why bother? The part time coordinators are very isolated and forgotten about.  Constantly feel like an outsider. The turnover is awful in the coordinator department.  So many good people that left. No growth opportunities for coordinators (even if they are great at what they do).  Finally, I witnessed an individual in management yelling at another employee in their face.  They have no idea how to be an effective manager.

pros: Great program for kids And extremely beneficial.
cons: Nice place to work but I did notice a minority being treated unfair as well as favoritism being shown to certain people on certain levels. No I'm not a minority but I've seen first hand how they are treated in Alabama especially at this company and it's not good. I guess i began to notice more of this when i began to date outside my race and saw how I was given a lot more opportynities than another very hard worker. Staff members are great but Managers and Directors are not so great or fair.

pros: This organization has taught over a million Arizona students about financial literacy, work readiness, and entrepreneurship.  It's easy to see the impact of the programs first hand in JA BizTown or through the classroom programs, and the students love them, which makes working here very fun!
cons: No organization is perfect.  The jobs require you to work at a very fast pace, and there is not much down time.  If you like a high energy environment, this is a great place to work!  The salaries are in-line with other non-profits.

pros: This is a very flexible non-profit to work for. Its great for moms, as they can work their hours around their personal schedule for the most part. You are also given vacation days, sick days and personal days, even as a part-time employee.
cons: This non-profit does not offer benefits to part-time employees, aside from vacation time and sick days. I never saw an opportunity for advancement. We are also required to take time off in the summer for part-time employees, which is great, but usually at least half of it is unpaid.

pros: You get to meet a lot of people which is really great. There is a lot of activity and in my experience the team work is excellent. Everyone is working together towards a good cause. The information we provide to students is really improtant.
cons:
For the amount of work you do, a higher salary would be nice. I wouldn't say they really practice what the preach in terms of paying their employees versus what it says a college graduate should be making in their programs. 
Sometimes the job seems more number focused than it is about actually helping kids. There is a definitely a sales aspect to it.

pros: The company's mission is so relevant to society today. They are getting ready to celebrate 100 years of helping kids own their economic success. Programs are at no cost to schools. There is an opportunity to teach, raise funds, recruit volunteers and/or get schools on board. It is not just another "office job.
cons: There is a lot of employee turnover. Many programs are outdated and seem old to schools. Since it is a non-profit, every idea that costs money must be approved and may be shot down due to cost. Pay is not the greatest.

job_title: Fundraising Manager in San Francisco, CA
pros: Great workplace passion for the mission. Terrific place to learn fundamental fundraising and program management experience. Opportunities to move forward if  you are a hard worker, team player, and patient.
cons: Smaller local operations have a limited number of positions so you need to create your own opportunities and manage your own career path. Make a case for how you can make a contribution and support the big picture through promotion.

pros: You could work here forever, maybe someday earn OK money, occasionally received or was able to negotiate comp time
cons: Low pay, unhappy coworkers, high turnover, penny pinching and minimal positive feedback

pros: Wonderful staff, everyone is welcoming and warm. Works with you to ensure you're learning the most you possibly can.
cons: I wish I could have stayed longer! Nothing bad to say about this great organization.
